overview:
## Discussion

Because shader-bound tensors have dynamic extents, the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLTensorExtents/rank] of `dimensions` corresponds to the rank the shader function specifies, and `MTLTensorExtents/extentsAtDimensionIndex:` always returns a value of -1.

# dimensions

**Instance Property**

The array of sizes, in elements, one for each dimension of this tensor.

## Declaration

```swift
var dimensions: MTLTensorExtents? { get }
```

## Discussion

Because shader-bound tensors have dynamic extents, the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLTensorExtents/rank] of `dimensions` corresponds to the rank the shader function specifies, and `MTLTensorExtents/extentsAtDimensionIndex:` always returns a value of -1.
title: dimensions
